name: The Missing Link Trivia Game | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: The theory of relativity, a Paul Mccartney and Wings tune, and a white rat.
questions.explanation:
Albert & Alberts.

	Albert Einstein's theory, the song 'Uncle Albert', and Little Albert, the subject of a famous psychology experiment. Behaviorist John P. Watson, experimenting in the days where human experimentation was not too regulated, paired a scary sound with the presentation of a white rat to 11 month old Little Albert. Although Albert started out interested in the rat, within a few pairs of rat and noise he became terrified at the mere sight of the rodent, even when the noise wasn't present.

questions.text: Bette Midler, the city of Portland, Oregon, and a war between the Plantagenets in England.
questions.explanation:
Rose & Roses.

	Bette Midler starred in the movie 'The Rose', Portland is the 'City of Roses', and the war between the two branches of the Plantagenet family is the War of the Roses.

questions.text: Aristophanes, your throat, and a flower arrangement.
questions.explanation:
frog & frogs.

	The Greek playwright Aristophanes wrotye 'The Frogs.' You might have 'a frog in your throat.' And the doodad that holds up the flowers in a flower arrangement is called a 'flower frog.'

questions.text: OK- a somewhat easier one now- a dollar bill, a wild horse, and a deer.
questions.explanation:
Buck & Bucks.

	Slang for the bill, what a wild horse does, and term for a male deer.

questions.text: The Beatles, a cook and a dormouse, and a popular soda.
questions.explanation:
Pepper & Peppers.

	'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band', a dispute in Alice in Wonderland over whether tarts are made of pepper, and Dr. Pepper.

questions.text: President Clinton, a bird, and the House of Representatives
questions.explanation:
bill & Bills.

	Bill Clinton, a bird's bill, and bills passed by a legislature.

questions.text: An office supply store, basic dietary items, and the Los Angeles Clippers.
questions.explanation:
Staples.

	'Staples' is the store, staples are basic dietary items, and the Clippers play in the Staples Center.

questions.text: A knight, a cell phone, and San Diego, CA.
questions.explanation:
Chargers & Charger.

	The knight on his white charger, a cell phone charger, and the San Diego Chargers football team.

questions.text: San Francisco, a card game, and dental work.
questions.explanation:
Bridge & Bridges.

	The Golden Gate Bridge, the game of bridge, and a dental bridge.

questions.text: Tennis, elegant people, and the bottom of your foot.
questions.explanation:
Balls & Ball.

	Tennis ball, a dance ball, and the ball of your foot.
